1.title: Crossing the line
1.plot: All the stories of young athletes begin with the same dream: becoming a champion. The dream might stay intact, but the way to get there is often filled with secrets. A young boy watches his dad win the amateur cycling races every weekend. What he also witnesses are the street fights between cyclists who are high on amphetamines and alcohol. He is fascinated by this physical and mental violence and wants to become a cyclist like his dad. A street soccer player is offered a pro contract for the Italian Premier League, but very soon he finds himself getting a huge amount...

2.title: Truth or dare
2.plot: In sports, once you get involved in doping, there's only one option: lying. But what happens when you get mixed up in your own lies? Or when you have to double-cross your own wife to save your soul? A doping control officer falls in love with a doped athlete and decides to help her buy EPO. An elite cyclist devises a near-perfect ruse to outsmart the anti-doping authorities and win the Tour the France. A cross-country ski coach crashes into a police roadblock after fleeing from a razzia at the Olympic village.

3.title: The living end
3.plot: Sports can be an expressway to escape reality. And medications aren't always used for what they were meant. A quadriplegic alpinist mutilates himself in order to seek the same adventures he had before his fatal car accident. The widow of a cyclist recounts the on and off the bike excesses of her late husband when he was overexposed to medication. A once successful bodybuilder pays an ironic price for his young man's wish to become different than the average man. Using chemicals and pain stimuli to reach brief moments of ecstasy, the three stories in this film have a ...

4.title: Circus of deceit
4.plot: Institutions officially are against doping. But in reality, they only have one aim: to get medals. A GDR athlete falls into the state organised program of the Stasi, blinded by her need to escape physical violence at home and her wish to become a superstrong 'hybrid' woman. A doctor is asked to lead the first anti-doping program for the American Olympic committee, but his successor raises questions about who got 'caught' and who didn't. A powerlifter infiltrates a medical study that seeks to determine wether steroids truly work or not, but sabotages the experiment. ...

imdb.plot outline: Most often, after a positive doping test comes a dead silence. Or a non-sincere confession. Stuff starts when the hysterical news cameras left the scene, and explores the strange logic of lies and excesses that sports athletes experience once they have crossed the doping line. A contemplative journey told from the point of view of so-called doping sinners that expose their forbidden but often daily habits in the microworld of sports. It tells twelve intriguing stories, involving both world class athletes (with testimonies from Ben Johnson, Michael Rasmussen, or Yulia Stepanova, whistleblower in the recent doping scandal in Russian athletics), but also less known people from amateur level and paralympic sports (alpinism, biathlon), two dubious doping control officers and a doping dealer. All of them discuss in a surprisingly intimate way how it is to live in a parallel world that abides by its own shady codes and unwritten rules. Without prejudice, Stuff penetrates right into the moral ambiguity of these alleged cheaters and liars.
imdb.title: Spul
